resource_data:
<expression xsi:schemaLocation="http://www.imsglobal.org/xsd/imslorsltitm_v1p0 http://fire.eun.org/lode/imslorsltitm_v1p0.xsd" xmlns="http://www.imsglobal.org/xsd/imslorsltitm_v1p0" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance">
  <identifier>
    <catalog>hdl</catalog>
    <entry>10494/104950</entry>
  </identifier>
  <identifier>
    <catalog>expression-cmr-id</catalog>
    <entry>104950</entry>
  </identifier>
  <description>
    <facet>
      <vocabularyID>LRE.expressionDescriptionFacetValues</vocabularyID>
      <value>main</value>
    </facet>
    <metadata>
      <schema>http://ltsc.ieee.org/xsd/LOM</schema>
      <lom xsi:schemaLocation="http://ltsc.ieee.org/xsd/LOM http://ltsc.ieee.org/xsd/lomv1.0/lomLoose.xsd" xmlns="http://ltsc.ieee.org/xsd/LOM">
        <general>
          <identifier>
            <catalog>oercommons.org</catalog>
            <entry>1770207003</entry>
          </identifier>
          <title>
            <string language="en">A Sense of Water</string>
            <string language="x-mt-de">Eine Richtung des Wassers</string>
            <string language="x-mt-fr">Un sens de l'eau</string>
            <string language="x-mt-pt">Um sentido da água</string>
            <string language="x-mt-it">Un senso di acqua</string>
            <string language="x-mt-el">Μια αίσθηση του ύδατος</string>
            <string language="x-mt-es">Un sentido del agua</string>
          </title>
          <description>
            <string language="en">This site asks students to discover how the need for water can be felt, seen, and heard in the song, voice, craft, religion, and ritual of a culture. They then capture this sense of water in a narrative poem.</string>
          </description>
          <keyword>
            <string language="en">Social Sciences</string>
          </keyword>
          <language>en</language>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-de">Diese Site bittet Kursteilnehmer, zu entdecken, 
wie die Notwendigkeit am Wasser Filz sein kann, gesehen, und im Lied, 
in der Stimme, in der Fertigkeit, in der Religion und im Ritual einer 
Kultur gehört. Sie erfassen dann diese Richtung des Wassers in 
einem erzählenden Gedicht.</string>
          </description>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-fr">Ce site demande à des étudiants de découvrir 
comment le besoin d'eau peut être feutre, vu, et entendu dans la 
chanson, la voix, le métier, la religion, et le rituel d'une culture.
Ils capturent alors ce sens de l'eau dans une poésie narrative.</string>
          </description>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-pt">Este local pede que os estudantes descubram como a
necessidade para a água pode ser feltro, visto, e ouvido na canção,
na voz, no ofício, na religião, e no ritual de uma cultura. 
Capturam então este sentido da água em um poema narrativo.</string>
          </description>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-it">Questo luogo chiede agli allievi di scoprire come 
l'esigenza di acqua può essere feltro, visto e sentito nella canzone,
nella voce, nel mestiere, nella religione e nel rituale di una 
coltura. Allora bloccano questo senso di acqua in un poem 
narrativo.</string>
          </description>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-el">Αυτή η περιοχή ζητά από τους σπουδαστές για να 
ανακαλύψει πώς η ανάγκη για το ύδωρ μπορεί να γίνει αισθητή, να
δει, και να ακουστεί στο τραγούδι, τη φωνή, την τέχνη,
τη θρησκεία, και το τελετουργικό ενός πολιτισμού. 
Συλλαμβάνουν έπειτα αυτήν την αίσθηση του ύδατος σε ένα 
αφηγηματικό ποίημα.</string>
          </description>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-es">Este sitio pide que los estudiantes descubran 
cómo la necesidad del agua puede ser fieltro, visto, y oído en la 
canción, la voz, el arte, la religión, y el ritual de una cultura. 
Entonces capturan este sentido del agua en un poema narrativo.</string>
          </description>
          <keyword>
            <string language="x-mt-de">Sozialwissenschaften</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="x-mt-fr">Les Sciences Sociales</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="x-mt-pt">Ciências Sociais</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="x-mt-it">Scienze Sociali</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="x-mt-el">Κοινωνικές επιστήμες</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="x-mt-es">Ciencias Sociales</string>
          </keyword>
        </general>
        <metaMetadata>
          <identifier>
            <catalog>oercommons.org</catalog>
            <entry>1770207003</entry>
          </identifier>
          <language>en</language>
        </metaMetadata>
        <educational>
          <language>en</language>
        </educational>
        <rights>
          <copyrightAndOtherRestrictions>
            <source>copyrightAndOtherRestrictionsValues</source>
            <value>yes</value>
          </copyrightAndOtherRestrictions>
          <description>
            <string language="en">Custom License</string>
          </description>
        </rights>
      </lom>
    </metadata>
  </description>
  <manifestation>
    <identifier>
      <catalog>manifestation-cmr-id</catalog>
      <entry>104950</entry>
    </identifier>
    <name>
      <vocabularyID>LRE.manifestationNameValues</vocabularyID>
      <value>experience</value>
    </name>
    <item>
      <location>
        <uri>http://www.oercommons.org/courses/a-sense-of-water</uri>
      </location>
    </item>
  </manifestation>
</expression>
